tool.name: RECETOX apLCMS - compute clusters
tool.description: compute clusters of m/z and RT and assign cluster ID to individual features

configfiles.configfile:
#set filenames = str("', '").join([str($f.element_identifier) for $f in $files]) feature_tables <- load_parquet_collection(filenames) sample_names <- lapply(feature_tables, load_sample_name)
ordering <- order(sample_names) feature_tables <- feature_tables[ordering] sample_names <- sample_names[ordering]
clusters <- compute_clusters( feature_tables = feature_tables, mz_tol_relative = $mz_tol_relative, mz_tol_absolute = $mz_tol_absolute, mz_max_diff = 10 * $mz_max_diff, rt_tol_relative = $rt_tol_relative, sample_names = sample_names )
add_sample_names(clusters, sample_names) save_parquet_collection(clusters, sample_names, "clustered") save_tolerances(clusters, $tolerances)

tool.help:
This is a tool which runs apLCMS clustering. It uses tolerances to group features with m/z and RT within the tolerance into clusters, creating larger features from raw data points. Custom tolerances for m/z and RT are computed based on the given parameters.
@GENERAL_HELP@
